text: Mladen Dodić (; born 17 October 1969) is a Serbian football manager and former player. ==Playing career== Dodić made his first-team debut for Napredak Kruševac in 1990. He spent seven seasons with the club, before moving to Železnik in 1996. Two years later, Dodić returned to Napredak Kruševac. In September 2001, Dodić moved abroad and signed with Maltese side Pietà Hotspurs. He was released the next month, having played just one match for the club. ==Managerial career== In December 2014, Dodić was appointed manager of the Serbia national under-21 team, succeeding Radovan Ćurčić, who took over Serbia's senior national team the month prior. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|League |- !Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="4"|Napredak Kruševac |1989–90 |17||3 |- |1990–91 |33||4 |- |1991–92 |22||3 |- !Total !72!!10 |} ==References== ==External links== * Srbijafudbal profile * * * Category:Association football midfielders Category:Expatriate football managers in Bulgaria Category:Expatriate footballers in Malta Category:FC Lokomotiv 1929 Sofia managers Category:First League of Serbia and Montenegro players Category:FK Borac Čačak managers Category:FK Jagodina managers Category:FK Javor Ivanjica managers Category:FK Napredak Kruševac managers Category:FK Napredak Kruševac players Category:FK Novi Pazar managers Category:FK Železnik players Category:Maltese Premier League players Category:People from Gjakova Category:Pietà Hotspurs F.C. players Category:Serbia national under-21 football team managers Category:Serbian expatriate football managers Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Bulgaria Category:Serbian football managers Category:Serbian footballers Category:Serbian SuperLiga managers Category:Yugoslav footballers Category:1969 births Category:Living people
